This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Love is the message communicated by Miyazawa, and he was also a dedicated artist who did not place his creed before his creativity, and who chose the difficult path of a writer who was concerned with life. The world held in Miyazawa's poems is a world overflowing with diverse emotions and beautiful and bitter comedy.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the cat, and the cat ends up killing them. Well, until they grow horns and are resurrected to kill.
